column4: mumbles, you are in a channel with 1k people and if they all did that it would be unsuable do this     >>/away put your reason here<< and then no one except the person who wants you knows that your off and we can all live in peace
s/unsuable/unusable/g
k
we want to get rid of his proxy setting
from? web browser or apt?
apt ... it was using the proxy
very easy in synaptic
than talk him through it ... i don't run ubuntu :)
seems he is getting enough help
only noticed his problem was that he was connecting to a proxy running on his local machine
he says he was using JAP proxy, and uninstalled it. For some reason it is still trying to use the proxy ...
well he should not be pointing at it now :)
yes, 'shouldn't be', but is ... maybe not purged
well his software should not be using it now if he has done what I said
that was the gui thing I just did :)
ah ok, i'll leave it in your capable hands
just his $http_proxy keeps getting set back to localhost ....
I think what happened is that sudo apt-get remove --purge packagename was not doen
yeah ... not being on ubuntu, how does he know make sure all the anon-proxy files are purged?
there is the most obvious one :-)
get progam "bum" installed and use it to turn off that proxy item simple gui for daemon management
I must depart
